sen.j: 院評定（いんのひょうじょう）とは、院政において太上天皇あるいは法皇が主宰した議定のこと。
sen.e: In-no-hyojo was an agreement presided by the retired emperor or cloistered emperor during his post-retirement government.
In-no-hyojo was an agreement presided by the retired emperor or cloistered emperor during his post-retirement government.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: In-no-hyojo was an agreement presided by the retired emperor or cloistered emperor during his post-retirement government.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 平安時代末期、院政の進展に伴って内裏における陣定に代わって、上皇や法皇が自分の御所内において議定を行って重要な決定を行うようになった。
sen.e: At the end of the Heian Period, with the development of government by a retired emperor, the abdicated emperor and cloistered emperor came to make important decisions after formulating agreements at their own residence, replacing the reign of the emperor at the Imperial Palace.

At the end of the Heian Period, with the development of government by a retired emperor, the abdicated emperor and cloistered emperor came to make important decisions after formulating agreements at their own residence, replacing the reign of the emperor at the Imperial Palace.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: At the end of the Heian period, with the development of government by a retired emperor, the abdicated emperor and cloistered emperor came to make important decisions after formulating agreements at their own residence, replacing the reign of the emperor at the Imperial Palace.
sen.cmt: 表記を変えました。

sen.j: この際に参加出来たのは公卿全般ではなく、上皇・法皇が認めた特定の公卿並びに院近臣達であった。
sen.e: Not all court nobles were allowed to join the decision-making processes, and only the specific court nobles and in-no-kinshin or aides permitted by the abdicated emperor and cloistered emperor could join.
sen.cmt: 「この際に」は「この決定を行う際に」の意味に解釈して訳しました。
sen.e: Not all court nobles were allowed to join the decision-making processes, and only specific court nobles and in-no-kinshin or aides permitted by the abdicated emperor and cloistered emperor could join.
sen.cmt: Grammar
sen.e: Not all court nobles were allowed to join the decision-making processes, and only specific court nobles and In no Kinshin (the retired Emperor's courtier) could join.
sen.cmt: 用語集に合わせました。

sen.j: 後嵯峨院による院政下の寛元4年（1246年）に院政の改革が行われた。
sen.e: The retired Emperor Gosaga revised the government by a retired emperor in 1246 during his post-retired government.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The retired Emperor Gosaga revised the government by a retired emperor in 1246 during his post-retired government.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Gosagain revised the government by a retired emperor in 1246 during his post-retired government.
sen.cmt: 用語集に合わせました。

sen.j: 鎌倉幕府の評定衆に倣って西園寺実氏ら5人の評定衆が任命されるとともに開催場所も院庁の文殿である「院文殿（いんのふどの）」と定められた。
sen.e: Similarly to the hyojoshu of the Kamakura bakufu, five members including Saneuji SAIONJI were appointed to hyojoshu, and the 'In-no-fu-dono' or government office in the in-no-cho (chancellery) was designated as the venue.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Similarly to the hyojoshu of the Kamakura bakufu, five members including Saneuji SAIONJI were appointed to hyojoshu, and the 'In-no-fu-dono' or government office in the in-no-cho (chancellery) was designated as the venue.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Similarly to the hyojoshu (a member of Council of State) of the Kamakura bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun), five members including Saneuji SAIONJI were appointed to hyojoshu, and the 'In-no-fu-dono,' Fumidono (the retired emperor's Documents Bureau) in the In no cho (Retired Emperor's Office) was designated as the venue.
sen.cmt: 用語集に合わせました。

sen.j: ここで訴訟や政治問題などの処理が行われるとともに、院文殿に記録所の機能が兼ね揃えられた。
sen.e: Lawsuits and political issues were processed at the venue, and the venue also served as the record office known as kirokusho of the in-no-fu-dono.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Lawsuits and political issues were processed at the venue, and the venue also served as the record office known as kirokusho of the in-no-fu-dono.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Lawsuits and political issues were processed at the venue, and the venue also served as Kirokujo (Land Record Office) of the in-no-fu-dono.
sen.cmt: 用語集に合わせました。

sen.j: 律令法や儒教に詳しい中下級公家が職員として置かれて、院評定を円滑に行うための補助的業務を行うようになった。
sen.e: The venue was staffed with middle to low-ranked court nobles who were versed in the ritsuryo-ho law and Confucianism to assist and facilitate the in-no-hyojo processes.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The venue was staffed with middle to low-ranked court nobles who were versed in the ritsuryo-ho law and Confucianism to assist and facilitate the in-no-hyojo processes.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: The venue was staffed with middle to low-ranked court nobles who were versed in the Ritsuryo codes and Confucianism to assist and facilitate the in-no-hyojo processes.
sen.cmt: 用語集に合わせました。

sen.j: 以後、院文殿における院評定が院政の中枢機関として活動するようになり、南北朝時代_(日本)末期に室町幕府によってその政治的権限を奪われるまで続いた。
sen.e: Since then, the in-no-hyojo at the In-no-fu-dono became the central organization for the government by a retired emperor until its political authority was deprived by the Muromachi bakufu at the end of the Period of Northern and Southern Dynasties (Japan).

Since then, the in-no-hyojo at the In-no-fu-dono became the central organization for the government by a retired emperor until its political authority was deprived by the Muromachi bakufu at the end of the Period of Northern and Southern Dynasties (Japan).

sen.e: Since then, the in-no-hyojo at the In-no-fu-dono became the central organization for the government by a retired emperor until its political authority was deprived by the Muromachi bakufu at the end of the period of the Northern and Southern Courts (Japan).
